discoveredAssets: localhost:32768 - PHP Blog Application (Apache 2.4.54, PHP 7.4.33, MySQL) - Port 32768, Session management enabled
admin.php - Administrator authentication panel - Form-based login with username/password
/?category=X - Blog post category filter endpoint - GET parameter vulnerable to SQL injection

targets.objective: Test admin authentication for SQL injection, weak password validation, session management flaws, CSRF vulnerabilities, and credential brute-force attacks
targets.rationale: Admin panel is critical infrastructure protecting administrative access. Accessible endpoint with authentication mechanism that may have multiple security flaws including SQL injection in login form, default credentials, session fixation, or CSRF token absence

targets.objective: Exploit SQL injection vulnerability in category parameter for database enumeration, authentication bypass, privilege escalation, and potential file read/write attacks
targets.rationale: CRITICAL vulnerability confirmed: Single quote injection triggers SQL error message revealing query structure. This allows extraction of database schema, user credentials, sensitive data, or modification of database records

targets.objective: Test main blog endpoint for XSS in post content, CSRF attacks on forms, information disclosure from PHP errors, and business logic flaws
targets.rationale: Main application entry point handling user input through category parameter and potentially post creation forms. PHP error messages visible in source code indicating information disclosure risk

keyFindings: [CRITICAL] SQL Injection vulnerability confirmed in category parameter - Query error messages expose database structure: /?category=' returns SQL syntax error revealing WHERE clause and ORDER BY statement
[CRITICAL] Admin authentication interface at /admin.php accessible without authentication requirements - potential brute force attack vector
[HIGH] PHP error notices exposed in application output - Undefined variable warnings disclose source file paths (/var/www/html/index.php, /var/www/html/admin.php) and line numbers
[HIGH] Session management enabled but no visible CSRF protection tokens in forms - potential for Cross-Site Request Forgery attacks on admin actions
[MEDIUM] Directory listing appears to be disabled for /images/ directory (403 Forbidden) but static files are accessible individually
[MEDIUM] No apparent API documentation, robots.txt, or sitemap.xml - application relies solely on direct URL access for navigation
